    • Constructor Detail

      • Stations

        public Stations(java.lang.String strInputFileName)
         throws java.io.IOException
        The purpose of this constructor is to accept the winds aloft filename as an argument and set it as a class variable before opening the file. Then, if the file exists it reads the data into two ArrayLists, staList for the data and staIndex for the Station IDs. Finally, it closes the input file.
        Parameters:
        strInputFileName - The Winds Aloft data file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Does nothing

    • Method Detail

      • exists

        public java.lang.Boolean exists(java.lang.String strStationID)
        The purpose of this method is to return true if the station exists in ArrayList staIndex.
        Parameters:
        strStationID - The 3 character Station ID
        Returns:
        staIndex.contains(strStationID) True or False

      • getStationID

        public java.lang.String getStationID(int intPosition)
        The purpose of this method is to return the StationID at ArrayList staIndex's given ListPosition.
        Parameters:
        intPosition - the ordinal within ArrayList staIndex
        Returns:
        strStationID - the 3 letter code for the airstation

      • getStaWea

        public java.lang.String getStaWea(java.lang.String strStationID)
        The purpose of this method is to return the full station weather string from ArrayList staList. If it does not exist it returns "Station Not Found."
        Parameters:
        strStationID - The 3 character Station ID
        Returns:
        strStationData The Station Weather data

      • length

        public int length()
        The purpose of this method is to return number of stations in ArrayList staIndex.
        Returns:
        staIndex.size()
